p: Essential oils of South American plants from the Verbenaceae family contain as their main components monoterpenes and sesquiterpenes, such as thymol, Î²-caryophyllene, citral, 1,8-cineole, carvone, and limonene. The presence of these compounds, which increase or alter the permeability of bacterial membranes, could explain their antimicrobial action and their synergistic effect with antibiotics.
